REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create(body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶
The create function creates a new contact in the database.

It takes a ContactModel object as input and returns the newly created contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object that was created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.find_contact_by_email(contact_email: str, db: Session)¶

The find_contact_by_email function takes in a contact_email and db as parameters. It then queries the database for all contacts with that email address, and returns them.

Parameters:

  • contact_email – str: Specify the email of the contact that we want to find

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.find_contact_by_firstname(contact_firstname: str, db: Session)¶

The find_contact_by_firstname function takes in a contact_firstname and db as parameters. It then queries the database for all contacts with that first name, and returns them.

Parameters:

  • contact_firstname – str: Pass in the first name of a contact to search for

  • db – Session: Pass in a database session object

Returns:

A list of contacts with the given first name

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.find_contact_by_lastname(contact_lastname: str, db: Session)¶

The find_contact_by_lastname function takes in a contact_lastname and db as parameters. It then queries the database for all contacts with that last name, and returns them.

Parameters:

  • contact_lastname – str: Pass in the last name of a contact

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.find_contacts_birthday(db: Session)¶

The find_contacts_birthday function finds all contacts in the database whose birthday is within 7 days of today. It returns a list of Contact objects.

Parameters:

db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email: str, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_by_email function returns a contact object from the database based on the email address provided.
Args:

email (str): The email address of the contact to be retrieved. db (Session): A connection to our database, which is used for querying and updating data.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the contact to be returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact with the given email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact object from the database based on its id.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the desired contact. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact that is being requested

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The contact object associated with the given id

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of all contacts in the database.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶
The remove function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be removed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was removed, or none if no such contact exists

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶
The update function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactModel): The updated information for the specified contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact by id

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the contact data to update

  • db – Session: Create a connection to the database

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session)¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Ensure that the data passed in is of type usermodel

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email if it exists. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of parameter that will be passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object if the email exists in the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token, db: Session)¶
The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.
Args:

user (User): The User object to update. refresh_token (str): The new refresh token to store in the database. db (Session): A connection to our Postgres database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • refresh_token – Update the user’s refresh token in the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

It takes an email, first_name, last_name and phone number as input parameters. The function returns the newly created contact object.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer as a parameter, which is the ID of the contact to be deleted. It also takes in two dependencies: db and current_user.

  • db is used to access our database session, so that we can make changes to it (in this case deleting).

  • current_user is used for authentication purposes; only users who are logged into their account can delete contacts.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id to be deleted

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The deleted contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.find_contact_by_firstname(contact_firstname: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The find_contact_by_firstname function is used to find a contact by their first name.

The function takes in the contact’s first name as an argument and returns the contact object if found.

Parameters:

  • contact_firstname – str: Get the firstname of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.find_contact_by_lastname(contact_lastname: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The find_contact_by_lastname function is used to find a contact by their last name.

The function takes in the contact’s last name as an argument and returns the contact object if found.

Parameters:

  • contact_lastname – str: Find the contact by lastname

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.find_contacts_birthday(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The find_contacts_birthday function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays in the current month.

The function takes no parameters and returns a list of contact objects.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given ID. If no such contact exists, it raises an HTTP 404 error.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact_id of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • le – Limit the maximum number of contacts to 500

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before returning results

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the token

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id and a body as input, and returns the updated contact. If no contact is found with that id, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Specify the data that will be sent in the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the id of the contact to be updated

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contactmodel object, which is the same as what we use for creating contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information.

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database
